comment.text:
I loved roasters.  The food they have is solid comfort food that may put you to sleep lol.  I had the white chicken chili (super filling), ribs, chicken tenders, loaded potato, and bread.  Now it may sound odd to say bread...but they have these muffins without panties (that paper that muffins come in usually) and biscuits that are damn everything!

The service was good.  The last time that I went, we sat outside and they had a leak that was leaking on our table.  Trying to convey what was happening to the manager was a little bit pointless because he kept looking at the pipe instead of moving our table, so we moved ourselves.  But the waitstaff was super friendly and understanding, even when we had to shift seats all together.   I wont take off for the whole pipe thing though, it can happen to anyone.

The muffins and biscuits, they are not free like other restaurants, but they are so worth it.  They come out warm and the butter spreads so easily, we ordered a few baskets of those (which probably led to us getting full lol).  The chili I ordered I thought was going to be a small bowl, nope!  It was huge and was probably the reason that I didnt finish my food!  But thats okay.  The Ribs were pretty flavorful and the chicken tenders were really good with that honey mustard.   The potato needed extra sour cream but once I got that, it got devoured too.  I want to try something else but I would have no issue getting what I got last time all over again. 

This spot is not the best food in the world but if you want good and solid comfort food, this one hits for me every time.  Depending on what time of day you go, you will have to fight for parking though so just be aware of that (the brunch spot across the parking lot has a lot of traffic).  This is a winner to me.

I've been going to different locations of this restaurant for probably 25 years. Roasters is consistently good - that's an impressively long time to be consistent. The ingredients are great and I physically feel like I've had home cooking after a meal here. I don't feel heavy or like I've had too much salt like some places. 
I've never ordered anything I didn't like but some of my favorites are their yeast rolls, corn bread, Mac and cheese, broccoli cauliflower casserole, cinnamon apples, cucumber salad, and chicken fingers. 
Their queso appetizer, though delicious, does unfortunately get thick and then pretty much solid weirdly fast - and the leftovers don't heat up well - it stays really thick. 
Obviously their roasted chicken is great. 
The ambiance is homey, not fancy, but always feels clean and maintained. 
I do wish they'd carry blue moon again.
It's a nice experience to eat in the restaurant and also to get to go.
Parking was much more plentiful before Toast opened in the same center. So if you are going during peak brunch hours (Toast has has a brunchy vibe), know that parking will take some time and I've noticed some drivers can be quite aggressive in the lot during these times as well. So be careful and patient during these times. 
If you haven't tried Roasters, I recommend you do!

The ribs were really tender and fell off the bone but the meat itself lacked a bit of seasoning. Just felt mostly like a rack of ribs smothered in barbecue sauce you'd get from the store. Pulled pork was okay, a bit too sweet but not that bad. Sides were very decent as well.

Service was quick and staff was very friendly & nice. Probably would not go back here again as I'm sure there are better barbecue spots in the area.

photos.caption: Pulled pork, half rack of 1/2 Rack BBQ Ribs & sides

comment.text: Update-Took my wife here again still great food!Service! and ambiance. I had turkey and dressing with sweet potato soufflé and broccoli-cauliflower casserole. Very good!  Bread was hot and filling.

Yummy lunch date today! The corn bread is absolutely amazing! I love the waiters here, so accommodating & friendly & they check on you often! Which is a plus especially when your lemon/water is getting low. :) before you can even ask there is a refill awaiting you! Ambiance is very calm & low key! We had the pleasure of meeting the owner today, who also checked in on us! Great food. Taste fresh! I had bbq chicken, green beans & a loaded baked potatoe! My buddy had tilapia with lemon pepper & Cajun seasoning with rice & greens! We enjoyed it! Will definitely come back to this gem!

My partner and I ordered the famous, slow-roasted rotisserie chicken (1/2 mix "Murph's Favorite" w cole slaw and sweet potato soufflé), BBQ baby back ribs (w cornbread stuffing and mac & cheese), and a side of chicken fingers -

TASTE: 4/5 - the rotisserie chicken was alright, nothing crazy; the dark meat (and skin!) was definitely tastier than the white. The baby back ribs were nice, along w the complimentary cornbread. Fave sides included the seasoned cole slaw and sweet potato soufflé 
TEXTURE: 4/5 - highlight was definitely the chicken fingers! The breading was great, and the way it was fried was perfection 
PRICE: 4/5 - prices aren't bad for BBQ
SERVING SIZE: 4/5 - good dinner portions, and took some leftovers home
SERVICE: 4/5 - we arrived at 5pm on a Sunday and Roasters wasn't busy yet. Our waiter was helpful and patient w the menu and our order  
ATMOSPHERE: 3/5 - low-key, country-style space 
PARKING: 5/5 - we found parking toward the back of Lenox Village plaza

photos.caption: Side of chicken fingers, and the famous, slow-roasted rotisserie chicken (1/2 mix "Murph's Favorite" w cole slaw and sweet potato soufflé)
BBQ baby back ribs (w cornbread stuffing and mac & cheese)

comment.text: This restaurant at best deserves 2 stars. One star is for the prompt and pleasant service. My granddaughter and I stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night. My granddaughter ordered the cheese dip, a cheeseburger and, for dessert, vanilla ice cream. She didn't complain, but I could see that she finished off only the ice cream. I ordered the grilled chicken breast, the cauliflower/broccoli casserole, mac-n-cheese, and fried okra. The chicken had the weirdest sauce ever - I can't even describe it - but it was not edible. The casserole was a lumpy mess, covered with way too much cheese. The fried okra was greasy - they really need to change the oil more often in their deep fryers. The mac-n-cheese was just alright. This place is not recommended.

So I finally tried Roasters and have to say it's pretty damn good home cooked meals. When I have my lazy days but want something good I usually lean towards Boston Market style food.

Not sure what Boston Market is doing but they have butchered their menu even more regarding sides and now I've discovered Roasters because of it.  For about 20-$30 you can get a menu of appetizers to choose from, 2 entrees and 2 sides with a soup. The day I ordered I opted for a spinach dip, chicken and rice soup, an order of tenders and a qtr chicken with mashed potatoes and spinach. The food was healthy, filling and delicious! This is my new spot for quick wholesome meals.  The tenders are probably some of the best I've had and aren't covered in a thick crunchy batter. They have a batter but offer more chicken and not overly salted. The dipping sauces that come with them are delicious as well.

If you're looking for good, no frills, tastes like my grandma's country cooking, look no further. The service was excellent. The food was delicious and the prices were very reasonable, especially with the portions you get. Our server, Zoe, was very sweet and the staff made us feel very welcome! They do offer bras for 50 cents each (rolls and cornbread). The meatloaf was my favorite!

photos.caption: Meatloaf and chicken breast combo with a baked potato and green beans

comment.text: Came for a quick snack and desert. And able to sit outside to enjoy the fresh air. The bowl of black bean soup was a nice comfort food, and had a nice thick texture. I thought the pork might overpower the rest of the soup or make it heavy so I was pleasantly surprised when it seemed to take a back seat to the black beans. The homemade cobbler was extremely hot, in fact too hot so I had to let it sit for several minutes even though there was ice cream on top. There was a nice blend of cinnamon to the sugar on top, the way a peach cobbler should be. Overall a nice spot to stop and try.

It's been several years since I was there, but my son was a cher at that time.

Do you remember Robert G Eberle? 
Excellent restaurant, great service and food.

We were in the area Sunday afternoon at Lenox mall and decided to grab lunch here because it was nearby. My husband is a regular here since it's near his office.  I don't remember coming before but he assures me I did. When we pulled into the plaza I was concerned when I saw how crowded it was.  Then I realized it was located across the parking lot from Toast on Lenox and it was still brunch time so not great timing on our part. Luckily for us our choice was not so crowded.  They offered dining inside or outside and I chose outside since the weather was unseasonably warm.  Also the inside looked as if it's seen better days.  The outside was actually enclosed and they didn't have the vinyl panels open so no fresh air.  But we were the only ones on the patio so still not bad. 
Our waiter was on point from start to finish, bringing things before we could even ask like a to-go container and bag. 
My husband knew what he wanted right away, rotisserie chicken ($13/half chicken comes with 2 sides).  But before that he insisted that we order bread, rolls and cornbread.  Once it arrived I could see why. They were served warm with butter and were very good.  Apparently they used to be complimentary but are now .50¢ each.  Worth it. I went with the fried chicken lunch special ($17/four pieces {leg, wing, breast, thigh} and two sides).  The order came out quick almost like fast food speed. 
The chicken was hot temperature wise and had good flavor.  The sides were pretty good but not as hot.  We finished with peach cobbler ala mode and it did not disappoint.  
Good food, great service and we were in and out in no time.

Roaster's is a culinary haven where the aroma of freshly roasted coffee beans welcomes you. The menu boasts a delightful array of dishes, each crafted with precision and flavor mastery. From the robust espresso to the succulent roasted chicken, every bite and sip is a journey through culinary excellence. The ambiance is warm and inviting, creating the perfect setting for a leisurely meal or a quick coffee catch-up. Roaster's is a must-visit for anyone seeking a gastronomic adventure with a side of unparalleled hospitality.
Worst order ever and the management is rude AF. Order was wrong and the manager told me to deal with Uber eats

photos.caption: Ordered meatloaf w mashed & stuffing but when I called to fix it the MANAGER told me it's not their problem & to call uber eats

comment.text: This has been one of our favorite spots for years. The food is always fresh, delicious, and leaves us full and satisfied. Their cornbread and rolls perfectly compliments the meal. Our server was attentive, friendly, and was very knowledgeable of the menu. The restaurant has a fun vibe and is a great place for friends and families to gather.

I came back home this weekend for the first time in years, and one of my best friends took me to this restaurant at the last minute. When we arrived, they were starting to. Close the nice German at the front  went to the back to see if they could sever us everyone said yes. Man, that was very awesome of them.
The food was Prepared excellent and you could tell it was not rushed and the presentation was awesome. Even our waiter was very tentative and did not rush us at all.
Thank you guys for the experience I had at your restaurant and trust and believe that every time I come back in town to visit family and friends, I will always. Make sure I'll stop by and patronize your restauright. The ambience is actually made for a couple or a family which which makes it very nice.
Have a great rest of 2023.

photos.caption: Salmon, Cream  of Broccoli, and one more Vegetable .

comment.text:
Food a bit bland. Service was great. 
I had the turkey loaf and dressing. My daughter had a chicken wrap that she liked.

Ate at Roaster's  tonight at Lenox.  The ribs were terrible - overcooked and dry.  I said something to the waitress and she was nice but the manager never came over.  Got the bill and saw they charged 50 cents for salad dressing - really?  I'm not eating here any more - heading to fat Matt's now to get good ribs because that's what I wanted for dinner.

The absolute BEST chicken chili on the planet! You can never go wrong ordering it from any location! Wonderful rotisserie chicken:whole, Hal, or quartered. Food travels well.
Pack a bit of your patients, as it does take a bit of time to recover your order... but well worth the wait!

Roaster's used to be one of our favorite places, sadly today, we were very disappointed. The white, chicken chili was as good as before but they are now charging for the rolls and cornbread. They have changed the menu and some of our favorites were gone (Santa Fe salad). The salad I did get was drenched in dressing. All-in-all a disappointing experience. As always, the service was great and the servers friendly. Miss the old food, though!
This place wasn't originally in our itinerary, BUT it is definitely a hidden gem. Nelson Jr. was our server, and he was really nice. I would recommend anyone to check this place out.

photos.caption: Pulled BBQ Pork Plate, Baby Limas, Mac & Cheese, Lemon Pepper Wings

comment.text: Came here for an early dinner and left a continuing customer. The ribs and corn bread alone were enough for me. I could've used a bit more seasoning in my green beans but overall the bbq sauce, bbq chicken were pretty good. I would come back again!

We were visiting Atlanta for the first time and Yelped places to eat. Based on the reviews and pictures posted from previous customers , we took our chances and we are so glad we did! There is a large variety of food to choose from and over twenty sides! As a family of four (two kids) we each got different meats and sides. All was delicious! The staff was very friendly and made sure we were well taken care of. The price was very reasonable especially for the amount of food you get. I would highly recommend! If we are ever in Atlanta, we know where to grab some good food!
Great servers, great food, great service! They never disappoint. Food comes out fast and fresh. I love their Mac and cheese! They have plenty of side options. Try their corn bread, it's So good!

Was expecting more. 

My service was great. I didn't get my waiter's name though. 

I ordered the chicken fried chicken and it literally tasted like an unseasoned and oversized chicken tender. The sides were trash. Corn tasted canned and it was watery. The dressing/cornbread stuffing tasted boxed and it was extremely soft/moist. I like mine a little thicker consistency that has a bit of chew. I ordered the soup upcharge side. The white bean chili soup. It was ok when you first bite into it with the cheesy layer then it falls downhill from there. 

That's all I got. Won't be back.

Had the 1/4 chicken and ribs combo with 2 sides. Mac and broccoli casserole w/ cornbread. Everything was tasty, and the  food always comes out quickly.  The whole staff is friendly and the manager checks to make sure you're content.  My server, Theresa, was very attentive and delightful...Price is reasonable...Its always a pleasure to come here.
Food came to me unseasoned , cold and tasted like it's been sitting out all day I'm very unpleased by that food

So another NO cooking night on Football Sunday. Me and the wife didn't want to experiment on another "ify" restaurant. So we went to another TO GO spot! We did an online order which was painless, and when we arrived our food was hot and ready to go! Roasters is definitely in our top 10 restaurants in Atlanta!
The best food and nicest servers. Always a favorite in Atlanta. I really like the chicken fingers here but everything is good.
Great Service with a friendly helpful staff.  Found this gem searching Yelp.  Great local find with great food choices on the menu.
This was my 1st time at this restaurant & the food was just ok. Mostly bland & the baked potato was extremely dry. The customer service however was great, everyone was very friendly.

This is a solid spot for some good home cooking style food.  The restaurant is close to my office and reasonably priced so it's great fit a team lunch.  

The rolls and corn bread are delicious and ask the food seems to be pretty fresh.  I usually get the rotisserie chicken with two sides either mashed potatoes,  broccoli casserole,  sweet potato casserole or Mac and cheese.  

For the price you can't go wrong and servings are huge.

Roasters on Lenox is an Atlanta staple. The restaurant is famous for their roast chicken. They serve other items as well but that's why you go here. I ordered the salad with rotisserie chicken to go. The food was ready in 5-10 minutes. The portion was big and the biscuit was delicious! I'd go back and try more of their sides.

Really heartbreaking to say this, but this restaurant has chosen to squeeze their patrons for every penny to the point that it is insulting. They raised all prices on the menu by $1-2 which is completely understandable. But immediately after enacting the new prices, they have begun other practices as well. Free complimentary cornbreads and rolls? Nope - now 65¢ each. Want two dipping sauces for your chicken tenders? You'll pay 50¢ for that second sauce. Are you walking in the heat and wanna pop in for a glass of water? That'll be $1 at the bar. The food is tasty and the servers are kind and courteous (shout out to Bree and Brendan and Isaac), but when your bill is suddenly $8 more just because you ordered bread for the table of 6 and a couple of sauces for your chicken is really steep and leaves a bad impression on patrons. To be noted, though the bread charge is on a note on the tables, none of the other surcharges are notated anywhere on the menu. So it truly is a surprise at checkout and it's noticeable in the lack of clientele. I'm currently writing this on their empty patio on a lovely Friday evening at 6:20pm (dinner rush) and the only tables here are my party of 3 and a party of 5. Inside, there are 4 tables. And barely any takeout orders going out either. Really sad to see this establishment drowning.

photos.caption: New additional inflation pricing - it's not noted but per the server, 65¢ per roll/cornbread

comment.text: Yelped this place for dinner and no regrets about it.  Just ordered a slab of BBQ, cauliflower & broccoli casserole, collard greens and unsweetened tea. Meat was soo tender and flavorful, casserole so rich and the greens balances it all.

We are at the "Roasters" Lenox Rd; the service was quick as we walked in... Seated right away and our waitress serviced us right away. I ordered the combo plate (bbq pulled chicken and ribs)... 

Totally recommend!!!

photos.caption: BBQ Ribs - Half Slab and bar bq pulled chicken
Salad & Soup Combo Caesar Salad Seafood Gumbo
Fresh Dinner rolls and cornbread muffins w/ creamy butter

comment.text:
One of the first places I dined at in ATL over 13 years ago and it's till one of our go to spots.  Great for large groups and they have something on the menu for everyone.  Consistently good service and food.  All things COVID related seem good.  
Large parking lot shared by several other shops and restaurants but Roasters is the anchor business.  They have a great patio they use even during the winter with overhead heating.  I will say when it's extremely cold the patio is not comfortable as they have some gaps in their plastic surround.  
One thing has changed, their rolls are just not the same but that's ok I think their corn muffins got better!
You can always trust on getting a fresh salad at Roasters too.  
Lenox Road can be a pain but there's a light to get into and out of this parking lot.

photos.caption: Country fried chicken mashed potatoes, fried okra, Mac n cheese.  Comfort food delivered  / Roasters ATL GA.
Turkey Dinner from Roasters Lenox Rd ATL
Side salad from Roasters Lenox Rd ATL
Another great meal @ Roasters ATL, Turkey/Dressing

comment.text: Have been going to Roasters, both locations, but mainly Lenox for 25 yrs. Since i've been going there for that long, needless to say my wife and i love the place. Ive even had my co workers hooked on the place.  Sunday, my wife went to order a whole chicken with 2 sides and mexican chicken with 3 sides. Sunday, i ate the mexican chicken with 2 sides no problems. Today i opened the container with chicken and there were no legs included. My wife called the place just to tell them that there were no legs. She was not looking for a refund just calling to let them know for training purposes but they were treating her like she was trying to get over. All we were looking for was accountability and acknolegement that they made a mistake. Nothing. Oh well, i wont be going back.

I think this place deserves a solid 3.5. The food was ok, but not phenomenal. But they do give you some pretty gigantic portions for incredibly reasonable prices. We all took home half of our food. 

My mom got chicken and brisket. She said it was good but the brisket was really fatty. My dad and I both got the special, which was basically a bacon burger on sourdough bread. Nothing special, but it popped once we added tobacco sauce on it. I got broccoli cauliflower casserole on the side and he opted for fried okra. 

Also, our server was soooo sweet. She really made the experience better. Also, I loved that how all the staff members were properly masked.

Upon walking into the establishment, my friend and I were met with inappropriate, hostile "jokes" from the staff because of our place of employment (we had our uniform shirts on & they immediately started talking "mess"). Now we planned on patronizing their business, however once Management didn't step in to rectify their employees' behavior, we left. Definitely will NOT be returning to try the food and will NOT be recommending to anyone.

A group o friends decided to meet in Santa Monioca for 4 days over a weekend. The Hotel is older, but has had an rennovation in the past few years. The rooms are OK, but the sinks in the bathroom are very small. To our huge surprise was the fact that the hotel shuts down the lobby over night. One of our friends was asked to leave the lobby around 6 AM as she was updating her emails and wanted to get out of the geust room. In 60 years of traveling the globe I never recall having a lobby closed down to guests unless their were repairs. We booked rooms on Marriott  points and was still charged over $30 a day in resort fees!

We ordered take out for Sunday brunch, which we thought it would be crowded. It was not. 

We got:
The chicken tenders with black eyed peas and broccoli/cauliflower casserole. The chicken fingers are like fish and chip type of fried chicken tenders. They are beer battered which I was pleasantly surprised by! The portions were a little small though. The fingers were a little bigger than nuggets but definitely not your typical tender sized. Casserole was cheesy and delicious. Black eyed peas were tasty as well! The salt and seasoning they used helped. 

Rotisserie chicken fingers with Mac and cheese, and spinach. This was okay. Again, portions were a little smaller than I thought they would be. Mac and cheese was good. Tasted similar to the broccoli/cauliflower casserole except without carbs :). Spinach was, well spinach. 

Overall, good food with a little smaller sized portion. The staff was very friendly during my interaction which is definitely a big plus in my book. I'd say 8 Gryffindor points out of 10.

photos.caption: Bottom: chicken rotisserie and top: Hand - dipped Chicken Tenders
Hand - dipped Chicken Tenders, cauliflower and broccoli casserole

comment.text:
To start, you should know that I am a Country Fried Steak fiend. Like, if I had to make a last meal request for some odd reason, it would most certainly be Country Fried Steak, fried okra, mac-n-cheese, a corn muffin and sweet tea. So, with that being said...this is exactly what I get when I come to Roasters, without fail, every time. And it is so dang good every single time! 

To start, Roasters is located in a small shopping center on Lenox Road that features a sushi place, taco place and a few other random businesses. Roasters sits on the end and directly on Lenox Road and features a decent size indoor seating dining room and a decent size covered patio. I have had the pleasure of dining on both and they are equally suitable to devour a plate of southern food on. 

I will say that I was consistently looking for a solid, well priced, casual southern food joint and I have definitely found it in Roasters. As previously mentioned, my go-to is the Country Fried Steak. Here it is priced at $11.99 and comes with 2 sides...but really it comes with 3 bc it is served on a bed of mashed potatoes! I always go with the staples for me of friend okra and mac-n-cheese. Neither of which ever disappoint. Prior to your meal being delivered, they provide the table biscuits and/or corn muffins with butter. Just get them both and enjoy, as they are delivered hot and fresh each time! Additionally, be prepared to take a to-go box home with you, as the servings are quite large for the price! 

Overall, Roasters is a solid choice for southern food in Buckhead and shoot, all of Atlanta. Don't fret if you aren't a big southern cuisine aficionado, they have a massive menu with everything from hot dogs to quesadillas. Simply put, you will find something you like! 

Go. Just do it. I promise you will enjoy it!

The food here is fantastic. Take out is what most people get, and its great, but the sit down service is very attentive.

The corn bread is top notch, sweat, crusty, and buttery. The rolls are better than average. The large variety of classic southern sides is incredible. Some stand outs for me are the pan fried apples and the sweet potato casserole. (They call them slightly different names tho)

The tenders were probably my least favorite thing here. They use the same breading as they do on their country fried chicken, and it works gloriously on that, but is a bit too thick on the tenders. Still good tho. The rotisserie chicken is the main star. Its roasted to perfection, and their house bbq sauce is perfectly crafted for it.

Great value and great food.

My wife and I both had the rotisserie chicken house salad and it was absolutely wonderful.  The chicken was warm and. All the salad ingredients were cold and crisp and fresh.  Will definitely do this again.

I really used to love this place until yesterday. For the first time in 30 years they have started to charge for cornbread and rolls .65 cent each for bread. Absolutely ridiculous!!! I will not be coming back unfortunately hopefully the sandy springs location is still normal. VERY VERY disappointed!!!!

I just had one of the worst meals of my life. The special was a fish fry flounder and shrimp. What I got was a luke warm overcooked pile of formerly frozen marine life. The fries were also cold and rubbery. The coleslaw looked like it had been left uncovered in a fridge and was also warm. My server was told the food was not good but she offered no action to better the situation. 
Not going back anymore. There's better meals frozen at the grocery store.

I'm in the small minority of people who do not think this place is that great. I got the veggie plate with Lima beans, dressing, green beans, and broccoli/cauliflower casserole. I added the sweet potato soufflé. The Lima beans tasted weird; I can't explain it. The dressing was entirely too sweet. The green beans tasted like they were straight from a can. The casserole was fine. The soufflé left much to be desired. The best thing was the cornbread and roll, which is what bumped it up from one star. I won't be coming back.

photos.caption: The veggie plate with an extra side. This is the Before picture.
This is my After picture. As you can see I barely ate much of anything.

comment.text: We have been eating here for 7+ years now and have tried almost everything on the menu. Best home style cookin in the area! I'll give you 5 stars when you add fried okra back to the menu and on DoorDash!

Omg, how did I not know about this place? It's been here for 30 years and I've never heard of it! Everything we ordered was delicious! From the spinach dip to the barbecue ribs, we loved it all! We both had Sangrias in these huge gobblers (Red & Peach), I couldn't even finish mine....I swear everytime I took a sip, someone was adding to it. Lol.... the tortilla chips for our dip were baked fresh. The cornbread is absolutely amazing. It was a lot of food, so much that I have enough for lunch tomorrow. This location is in a strip mall on Lenox Rd, about a mile south of Lenox Mall. It's a real low-key place, so wear anything. Very diverse crowd.... great staff. Our server Lamar was fantastic--- he only works on Sundays. They have indoor and outdoor seating, so weather permitting.... enjoy! You will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Barbecue ribs and chicken w/ sweet potatoe souffle and Mac-n-cheese (or what's left)
BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich w/ Sweet Potato Souffle and Mac-n-Cheese
Spinach dip and fresh baked chips
